oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Atlas of the city of Nashville 1908. [Plate 08A]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1 map; 58 x 75 cm. A plat map of downtown Nashville, Tennessee, originally published in 1908 by G. M. Hopkins Company, showing the various buildings, landscapes, acreage, and street routes for several blocks. Original building structures are depicted on the map, such as Kayne Avenue Baptist church, Bethel Methodist Episcopal Church, Timothy Dry Goods Company, and two public schools. This plat map is reproduced from the source: Atlas of the city of Nashville, Tennessee : from official records, private plans and actual surveys, G. M. Hopkins, [Philadelphia, Pa.] 1908. Scale 150 feet to an inch. The original dimensions of the map, in the atlas publication: 15 1/2 x 22 3/4 in. (i.e. 58 x 75 cm.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Kayne Avenue Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Bethel Methodist Episcopal Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Timothy Dry Goods Company (Nashville, Tenn.)
